Operation 'UnScheduleCampaign' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Current description mentions the 204 response but lacks clarity about what the operation actually does to the campaign state. Added explicit explanation that the schedule is removed but campaign persists, clarified the side effect (schedule removal), and improved the conditional logic about in-progress campaigns for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to unschedule a campaign that has already been scheduled to be sent.**

A successful unschedule will return a 204.
If the specified campaign is in the process of being sent, the only option is to cancel (a different method).
data.description_suggestion: Removes the scheduled send time from a campaign that has been scheduled to be sent. Returns a 204 No Content response on success. Note: If a campaign is currently being sent, use the cancel method instead. This operation removes the send schedule but does not delete the campaign itself.
data.reasoning: Current description mentions the 204 response but lacks clarity about what the operation actually does to the campaign state. Added explicit explanation that the schedule is removed but campaign persists, clarified the side effect (schedule removal), and improved the conditional logic about in-progress campaigns for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'SendCampaign' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Current description explains the lack of request body but omits critical information about the operation's effects and return value. Added explicit mention of the 201 response, clarified that this is an immediate send action with irreversible consequences, and noted the prerequisite that the campaign must be configured. This helps AI agents understand the gravity and timing of this operation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to immediately send an existing campaign.**

Normally a POST request would have a body, but since this endpoint is telling us to send a resource that is already created, a request body is not needed.
data.description_suggestion: Immediately sends an existing campaign to all recipients without scheduling. No request body is required. Returns a 201 Created response on success. This operation triggers the campaign send process and cannot be undone once initiated. The campaign must be fully configured before sending.
data.reasoning: Current description explains the lack of request body but omits critical information about the operation's effects and return value. Added explicit mention of the 201 response, clarified that this is an immediate send action with irreversible consequences, and noted the prerequisite that the campaign must be configured. This helps AI agents understand the gravity and timing of this operation.

message: Operation 'SendTestCampaign' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_context. Current description is vague about the purpose and context of test sends. Added clarification that this is for preview/validation, explained the input format more clearly, specified the 201 response, and provided important context that test sends don't affect limits. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation versus the production send operation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to send a test campaign.**

To send to multiple addresses, use an array for the JSON "to" value ["one@address","two@address"]
data.description_suggestion: Sends a test version of a campaign to specified email address(es) for preview and validation before production send. Accepts a single email address or an array of addresses in the request body's "to" field. Returns a 201 Created response on success. Test sends do not count against campaign send limits and allow verification of campaign content and formatting.
data.reasoning: Current description is vague about the purpose and context of test sends. Added clarification that this is for preview/validation, explained the input format more clearly, specified the 201 response, and provided important context that test sends don't affect limits. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation versus the production send operation.

message: Operation 'CreateCampaign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary is too generic. Description lacks clarity about draft status, what fields are optional vs. required for sending, and what is returned. Added specificity about campaign lifecycle and return value for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to create a campaign.**

In order to send or schedule the campaign, you will be required to provide a subject, sender ID, content (we suggest both html and plain text), and at least one list or segment ID. This information is not required when you create a campaign.
- Tags: Campaigns API
- Parameters: 1 parameter(s)
- Request Schema: #/components/schemas/PostCampaignsRequest
- Response Schemas: 201
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new marketing campaign in draft status. Accepts campaign configuration including name, subject, sender ID, content, and recipient list/segment IDs. Note that subject, sender ID, content, and recipient information are optional at creation time but required before sending or scheduling the campaign. Returns the created campaign object with a 201 status code.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks clarity about draft status, what fields are optional vs. required for sending, and what is returned. Added specificity about campaign lifecycle and return value for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'GetCampaign' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details. Summary is adequate, but description is too minimal. Added details about what is returned (complete campaign object with configuration, status, metadata) and clarified the required parameter for better AI agent understanding of the operation's scope.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve a specific campaign.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the details of a specific campaign by its ID. Returns the complete campaign object including configuration, status, and metadata. Requires the campaign_id path parameter.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate, but description is too minimal. Added details about what is returned (complete campaign object with configuration, status, metadata) and clarified the required parameter for better AI agent understanding of the operation's scope.

message: Operation 'DeleteCampaign' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Description is too brief and lacks critical information. Added details about deletion constraints (cannot delete scheduled/sending campaigns), irreversibility, and response behavior. This helps AI agents understand when deletion is possible and the consequences.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to delete a specific campaign.**
data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a specific campaign by its ID. The campaign must not be currently scheduled or sending. Deletion is irreversible. Returns a 204 No Content response on successful deletion.
data.reasoning: Description is too brief and lacks critical information. Added details about deletion constraints (cannot delete scheduled/sending campaigns), irreversibility, and response behavior. This helps AI agents understand when deletion is possible and the consequences.

message: Operation 'UpdateCampaign' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Description lacks specificity about what can be updated and how partial updates work. Added clarity about which fields can be modified, partial update behavior, and return value. This helps AI agents understand the operation's scope and when to use it versus full replacement.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update a specific campaign.**

This is especially useful if you only set up the campaign using POST /campaigns, but didn't set many of the parameters.
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing campaign's configuration using partial update semantics. Allows modification of campaign properties such as subject, sender ID, content, recipient lists, and other settings. Only provided fields are updated; omitted fields remain unchanged. Useful for completing campaigns created with minimal initial configuration. Returns the updated campaign object.
data.reasoning: Description lacks specificity about what can be updated and how partial updates work. Added clarity about which fields can be modified, partial update behavior, and return value. This helps AI agents understand the operation's scope and when to use it versus full replacement.

message: Operation 'ScheduleCampaign' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear, but description lacks information about campaign prerequisites, state changes, and return value. Added details about required configuration, status transition, immutability of scheduled campaigns, and return behavior. The existing best practice advice is valuable but needed context about what it enables.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to schedule a specific date and time for your campaign to be sent.**

If you have the flexibility, it's better to schedule mail for off-peak times. Most emails are scheduled and sent at the top of the hour or half hour. Scheduling email to avoid those times (for example, scheduling at 10:53) can result in lower deferral rates because it won't be going through our servers at the same times as everyone else's mail.
data.description_suggestion: Schedules a campaign for delivery at a specified date and time. The campaign must have all required fields configured (subject, sender ID, content, and recipient list/segment). Once scheduled, the campaign status changes to 'scheduled' and cannot be modified. Returns the scheduled campaign object with 201 status. Best practice: schedule for off-peak times (e.g., 10:53 instead of top of hour) to reduce deferral rates.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear, but description lacks information about campaign prerequisites, state changes, and return value. Added details about required configuration, status transition, immutability of scheduled campaigns, and return behavior. The existing best practice advice is valuable but needed context about what it enables.

message: Operation 'UpdateScheduledCampaign' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Description is incomplete and contains a typo ('allows to you'). Added specificity about what can be modified (send_at timestamp), campaign state requirements, return value, and constraints on rescheduling sent/sending campaigns. This clarifies when the operation is applicable and what it affects.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows to you change the scheduled time and date for a campaign to be sent.**
data.description_suggestion: Modifies the scheduled send time and date for a campaign that has been scheduled but not yet sent. Accepts new send_at timestamp. The campaign must be in 'scheduled' status. Returns the updated campaign object with the new schedule. Cannot be used to reschedule campaigns that are currently sending or have already been sent.
data.reasoning: Description is incomplete and contains a typo ('allows to you'). Added specificity about what can be modified (send_at timestamp), campaign state requirements, return value, and constraints on rescheduling sent/sending campaigns. This clarifies when the operation is applicable and what it affects.
